sen.j: 藤原 敦基（ふじわら の あつもと、永承元年（1046年） - 嘉承元年（1106年））は、平安時代後期の廷臣、漢詩人。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Atsumoto (1046-1106) was a retainer of Imperial Court and composer of Chinese poems in the late Heian period.
FUJIWARA no Atsumoto (1046-1106) was a retainer of the Imperial Court and a composer of Chinese poems during the late Heian period.
FUJIWARA no Atsumoto (1046-1106) was a court official and a composer of Chinese poems during the late Heian period.
sen.cmt: 廷臣retainer of the Imperial Court をcourt official に修正しました。

sen.j: 藤原式家の出身で父は文章博士藤原明衡。
sen.e: His family belonged to Fujiwara Shikike (a sub branch of Fujiwara family) and his father was FUJIWARA no Akihira, Monjo hakase (professor of literature).
His family belonged to Fujiwara Shikike (a sub branch of the Fujiwara family) and his father was FUJIWARA no Akihira, a Monjo hakase (professor of literature).
His family belonged to Fujiwara Shikike (a sub branch of the Fujiwara family) and his father was FUJIWARA no Akihira, a Monjo hakase (professor of literature).

sen.j: 母は安房国守平実重の娘。
sen.e: His mother was a daughter of TAIRA no Saneshige, Awa no kuni no kami (Governor of Awa Province).
His mother was a daughter of TAIRA no Saneshige, the Awa no kuni no kami (Governor of Awa Province).
His mother was a daughter of TAIRA no Saneshige, the Awa no kuni no kami (Governor of Awa Province).

sen.j: 弟に藤原敦光、明暹らが、子には藤原令明、藤原茂明らがある。
sen.e: His brothers include FUJIWARA no Atsumitsu and Meisen, and his children include FUJIWARA no Reimei and FUJIWARA no Shigeaki.
His brothers included FUJIWARA no Atsumitsu and Meisen, and his children included FUJIWARA no Reimei and FUJIWARA no Shigeaki.

sen.j: 正四位下、文章博士、上野介。
sen.e: Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade), Monjo hakase, Kozuke no suke (Assistant Governor of Kozuke Province)
Atsumoto held the rank of Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade), was a Monjo hakase and the Kozuke no suke (Assistant Governor of Kozuke Province).
sen.cmt: added "Atsumoto" as the subject and fixed to read more understandably; fixed grammar
sen.e: Atsumoto held the rank of Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade), was a Monjo hakase and the Kozuke no suke (Assistant Governor of Kozuke Province).

sen.j: 白河天皇の皇太子時代よりその傍に仕え、また藤原師実の家司をも務める。
sen.e: He not only served close to Emperor Goshirakawa since the emperor was a crown prince, but also worked as Keishi (household superintendent) of FUJIWARA no Morosane.
Atsumoto not only served close to Emperor Goshirakawa from the time the emperor was a crown prince, but also worked as Keishi (household superintendent) under FUJIWARA no Morosane.
sen.cmt: changed "He" to "Atsumoto" since this a new a paragraph; changed "since" to "from the time"; changed "of" to "under"
sen.e: Atsumoto not only served close to Emperor Goshirakawa from the time the emperor was a crown prince, but also worked as Keishi (household superintendent) under FUJIWARA no Morosane.

sen.j: 文章得業生より出発し、蔵人などを経た後、寛治2年（1088年）に文章博士に至る。
sen.e: Starting from the position of Monjo tokugosho (Distinguished Scholars of Letters) and promoted to Kurodo (Chamberlain), he finally reached Monjo hakase in 1088.
Starting from the position of Monjo tokugosho (Distinguished Scholars of Letters) and promoted to Kurodo (Chamberlain), Atsumoto finally became a Monjo hakase in 1088.
Starting from the position of Monjo tokugosho (Distinguished Scholars of Letters) and promoted to Kurodo (Chamberlain), Atsumoto finally became a Monjo hakase in 1088.

sen.j: 父と同様に学識に秀で、特に漢詩の才をもっては当代随一であった。
sen.e: He was superior in learning like his father and showed an outstanding talent particularly in composing Chinese poems.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: He excelled in his studies like his father and showed outstanding talent, particularly in composing Chinese poems.

sen.j: 凡そ文に属する者で敦基の弟子でない者はない、とまで謳われた。
sen.e: He was highly praised with words that he had an innate talent for literature and no poets had never been a pupil of Atsumoto.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: He was so highly praised for his innate talents in literature, it was said that no poet was not a pupil of Atsumoto.

sen.j: 著作として『国史後抄』『柱下類林』があり、また作品が『本朝続文粋』『本朝無題詩』などに収められている。
sen.e: He wrote "Kokushi go sho" and "Chukaruirin" and, in addition, books such as "Honcho Zoku Monzui (Literary Essence of Our Court, Continued)" and "Honchomudaishi (a collection of Chinese poem" include his works.

sen.j: 同時代の源義家と文武の双璧と称され、互いに交流も持った。
sen.e: Praised as the two greatest masters in the arts of pen and sword, Atsumoto and MINAMOTO no Yoshiie had a close relation with each other.
Praised as the two greatest masters in the arts of pen and sword, Atsumoto and MINAMOTO no Yoshiie held mutual respect for each other.

sen.j: 娘は義家の子・源義国に嫁いでいる。
sen.e: His daughter married a son of Yoshiie, MINAMOTO no Yoshikuni.
